question: Question_01
statement:
Find all values of \emph{c} such that the system of equations below is
consistent. For these values of \emph{c} write the general solution of
the system in the parametric vector form.

\begin{align*}
x_{1} + 4x_{3} - 2x_{4} &= 1\\
-x_{1}+x_{2}-7x_{3}+7x_{4} &= 2\\
2x_{1}+3x_{2}-x_{3}+cx_{4} &= 11
\end{align*}
sols:
From the system we are able to get the following matrix.
$\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 &4 &-2& |&1 \\ 
-1 &1 &-7 &7& |&2 \\ 
2&3 &-1 & c&|& 11
\end{bmatrix}$ By doing Gaussian Elimination, we are able to get the
matrix below $\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 &4 &-2& |&1 \\ 
0 &1 &-3 &5& |&3 \\ 
0&0 &0& c-11&|& 0
\end{bmatrix}$

If we look at the 3rd row of this matrix, we can easily see that
$\displaystyle x_{4}=0$ for any real value of b, which is to say that
for $\displaystyle b \in \mathbb{R}$, we have $x_{4}=0$.

Therefore, the matrix becomes

$\begin{bmatrix}
1& 0&4 &|& 1\\ 
0& 1& -3&|& 3\\ 
0& 0& 0&|& 0 
\end{bmatrix}$

Which can be solved easily. The general solution is\[\begin{bmatrix}
x1\\ 
x2\\ 
x3\\ 
x4
\end{bmatrix}\]=$\begin{bmatrix}
1\\ 
5\\ 
0\\ 
0
\end{bmatrix}$+$\begin{bmatrix}
-4\\ 
3\\ 
1\\ 
0
\end{bmatrix}$*$x_{3}$
